intro: Chlorophytum sparsiflorum, commonly known as the snake plant, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its upright, sword-shaped leaves that are typically green with white or silver markings. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers on slender stalks, which are followed by blue or purple berries. It is a hardy and low-maintenance plant, making it popular as a houseplant. Its ability to thrive in low light and poor soil conditions contributes to its widespread cultivation.
